intro: Uvaria utteridgei, commonly known as the African satinwood, is a tropical evergreen shrub or small tree native to Africa. It belongs to the Anacardiaceae family and is characterized by its dense, aromatic foliage and showy, fragrant flowers. The plant produces small, round, fleshy fruits that are yellowish-green when mature. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in horticulture.
